appendix.title: Documentation Updates
appendix.para: This chapter lists the most important content changes for this document since the release of &dapsacr; 1.0.
The manual was updated on the following dates:

listitem.para: taroth 2013-10-09: not sure if to mention this here, rather something for the developer guide ;)The make files have now been split into several smaller make files, that are specific for the respective output like PDF, or HTML.
The number of verbosity levels has changed, as have the defaults used on the command line and in scripts:
Command Line: Default verbosity level is now v1, which shows all result messages and warnings.
Scripts: Default verbosity level is now v0, which shows the file names.

The verbosity levels v0, v1, v2, and debug are unchanged, but a a new verbosity level has been added: v3. It shows the output of make -j1, where all commands are executed successively (no parallel processing). This makes the output easier to read than that of the debug verbosity level, where messages from parallel processes are shown in the order they arrive.
taroth 2013-09-10: not sure if to mention this (probably no doc impact)...Whereas &dapsacr; 1.x required Bash 4, &dapsacr; 2.0 is compatible with Bash 3.
command name changes (deprecated targets)
epub: now provides valid output (checked with epub-check)
new target: mobi (for Amazon Kindle e-books, requires calibre: epub is generated and transformed to mobi format with calibre)
html: html4 is no longer supported, per default, --html now generates xhtml 1.1, with the --html5 switch you can enforce HTML5 output
File list targets: renamed (now: list-*), some deprecated
list-srcfiles: now options available which files to exclude from list
new packaging target: package-src (creates tarball + profiled XML + resolved entities + images), new option --set-date to include publication date
new target for distributable archives: locdrop
bigfile target has changed: bigfile-reduced is deprecated, bigfile now does what was formerly done by bigfile-reduced
page, desktop, or document files: targets package-html and package-pdf now have switches which files to generate: --documentfiles, --desktopfiles, --pagefiles
new target: clean-package
new subcommand: dapsenv (prints a list of the most important make variables and their value)
are now always resolved in the profiles XML sources
if XML is not well-formed, &dapsacr; aborts and shows a meaningful error-message
daps --commands
jpeg now supported
&wip;
&dapsacr; now also supports the Saxon XSLT processor. Use the option --xsltprocessor to define which processor to use. Per default, xsltproc is used.
When passing XSLT parameters (either on the command line, in scripts, or in &dc; files by using XSLTPARAM), you need to adjust the syntax when switching to &daps; 2.0. Instead of
